TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ScrollBar/LeftTrackHorizontal extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the left part of a horizontal scroll bar track. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.LeftTrackHorizontal class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the horizontal scroll bar track to the left of the scroll box (also known as the thumb).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.LeftTrackHorizontal.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarLeftTrackHorizontal1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#93](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/698b9297-3876-44dc-b129-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#93](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/698b9297-3876-44dc-b129-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the left part of a horizontal scroll bar track in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents the left part of a horizontal scroll bar track in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarLeftTrackHorizontal4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#96](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/aa1b6a8d-8a50-40f1-9ebe-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#96](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/aa1b6a8d-8a50-40f1-9ebe-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the left part of a horizontal scroll bar track in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the left part of a horizontal scroll bar track in the hot state.

remarks.format:

Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarLeftTrackHorizontal2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
